conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph.
The graph shows the skydiver's vertical velocity over time.
From 0 to 10 seconds, the velocity increases, indicating that the skydiver is speeding up.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
If the velocity is increasing, the acceleration is positive.
If the velocity is decreasing, the acceleration is negative.
The slope of the velocity-time graph represents the acceleration.
A positive slope indicates positive acceleration.
A negative slope indicates negative acceleration.

premise: From 0 to 10 seconds, the velocity is increasing, which means the slope of the graph is positive.
conclusion: Therefore, the acceleration is positive during this interval.
Positive acceleration means the direction of acceleration is in the same direction as the velocity.

premise: Since the skydiver is moving downward (assuming the positive direction is downward), the acceleration is also downward.
conclusion: The direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is downward.
